name: places/ChIJl0rtoARZwokRP1qORrPYYxQ
formattedAddress: 25 Waterside Plaza, New York, NY 10010, USA
adrFormatAddress: 25 Waterside Plaza, New York, NY 10010-2621, USA

editorialSummary.text: Supermarket stocking meats, seafood, produce, dairy & baked goods, plus deli items.

originalText.text: This supermarket is extremely hard to get to, as it's not really designed for anybody outside of the residents of Waterside Plaza. Once you do get there (there's no signs, so go up to the plaza on the second level outside and the supermarket is at the front side), there's not much in the store. Limited selection of just about anything and the prices are pretty ridiculous for most stuff. I will say that the manager seemed quite friendly, but otherwise I've gotta say you're better off skipping this one.

originalText.text: This supermarket is the worst being run for success by wrong manager they missing the mark of making money in the great location  as much they don't know there a young man works in the same area that has all the knowledge of running the whole supermarket and start making real money for it .cause right now how it stand they need help in everything starting with the deli department and as of staff they need more training or get new staff this young guy that works in that same location for the building as a porter has all the right knowledge to turn found this supermarket from ordering merchandise to bringing back customers back and now this supermarket the hot spot for supply and food and be the supermarket this location need .get that young to run this supermarket now and fast let him make this business make real money .I get a hint hes Spanish ans he works as a porter  in one o those buildings hes name is Carlos works as a porter in building 40

originalText.text: Mixed experience. I was looking for a charging cable. Cashier was super friendly and helpful. The customer service representative could not have cared less. He was on his phone and ignored my question until someone else stepped in. Overall my experience of this place has been that it offers a decent limited selection at a slightly inflated price tag. Only worth going if you don’t have other options

originalText.text: Went here with my pals for a simple bag of Reeses peanut butter cup minis. What a dissapointment. All of the cups were prematurely wrapped, and the wrapper was stuck inside the chocolate covered and the sheer sight made my associates and I cringe. Seeing how they were my neighborhood grocer since 1888, I'd expect more. But I guess that's the flaw of American Capitalism as a whole.

originalText.text: Prices are ridiculous for everything. Even their sales are questionably priced.  It's much more beneficial to go to markets further away for a broader selection of everything at better prices.
